speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: SCENE II. The same.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, and DULL

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Very reverend sport, truly; and done in the testimony

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: of a good conscience.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The deer was, as you know, sanguis, in blood; ripe

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: as the pomewater, who now hangeth like a jewel in

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the ear of caelo, the sky, the welkin, the heaven;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: and anon falleth like a crab on the face of terra,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the soil, the land, the earth.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Truly, Master Holofernes, the epithets are sweetly

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: varied, like a scholar at the least: but, sir, I

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: assure ye, it was a buck of the first head.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir Nathaniel, haud credo.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: 'Twas not a haud credo; 'twas a pricket.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Most barbarous intimation! yet a kind of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: insinuation, as it were, in via, in way, of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: explication; facere, as it were, replication, or

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: rather, ostentare, to show, as it were, his

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: inclination, after his undressed, unpolished,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: uneducated, unpruned, untrained, or rather,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: unlettered, or ratherest, unconfirmed fashion, to

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: insert again my haud credo for a deer.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: I said the deer was not a haud credo; twas a pricket.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Twice-sod simplicity, his coctus!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: O thou monster Ignorance, how deformed dost thou look!

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Sir, he hath never fed of the dainties that are bred

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: in a book; he hath not eat paper, as it were; he

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: hath not drunk ink: his intellect is not

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: replenished; he is only an animal, only sensible in

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: the duller parts:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: And such barren plants are set before us, that we

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: thankful should be,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Which we of taste and feeling are, for those parts that

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: do fructify in us more than he.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: For as it would ill become me to be vain, indiscreet, or a fool,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: So were there a patch set on learning, to see him in a school:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: But omne bene, say I; being of an old father's mind,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Many can brook the weather that love not the wind.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: You two are book-men: can you tell me by your wit

speaker: DULL
text_entry: What was a month old at Cain's birth, that's not five

speaker: DULL
text_entry: weeks old as yet?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Dictynna, goodman Dull; Dictynna, goodman Dull.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: What is Dictynna?

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: A title to Phoebe, to Luna, to the moon.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The moon was a month old when Adam was no more,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: And raught not to five weeks when he came to

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: five-score.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The allusion holds in the exchange.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: 'Tis true indeed; the collusion holds in the exchange.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: God comfort thy capacity! I say, the allusion holds

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: in the exchange.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: And I say, the pollusion holds in the exchange; for

speaker: DULL
text_entry: the moon is never but a month old: and I say beside

speaker: DULL
text_entry: that, 'twas a pricket that the princess killed.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir Nathaniel, will you hear an extemporal epitaph

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: on the death of the deer? And, to humour the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: ignorant, call I the deer the princess killed a pricket.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Perge, good Master Holofernes, perge; so it shall

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: please you to abrogate scurrility.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will something affect the letter, for it argues facility.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The preyful princess pierced and prick'd a pretty

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: pleasing pricket;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Some say a sore; but not a sore, till now made

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: sore with shooting.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: The dogs did yell: put L to sore, then sorel jumps

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: from thicket;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Or pricket sore, or else sorel; the people fall a-hooting.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: If sore be sore, then L to sore makes fifty sores

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: one sorel.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Of one sore I an hundred make by adding but one more L.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: A rare talent!

speaker: DULL
text_entry: [Aside]  If a talent be a claw, look how he claws

speaker: DULL
text_entry: him with a talent.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: This is a gift that I have, simple, simple; a

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: foolish extravagant spirit, full of forms, figures,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: shapes, objects, ideas, apprehensions, motions,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: revolutions: these are begot in the ventricle of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: memory, nourished in the womb of pia mater, and

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: delivered upon the mellowing of occasion. But the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: gift is good in those in whom it is acute, and I am

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: thankful for it.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Sir, I praise the Lord for you; and so may my

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: parishioners; for their sons are well tutored by

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: you, and their daughters profit very greatly under

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: you: you are a good member of the commonwealth.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Mehercle, if their sons be ingenuous, they shall

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: want no instruction; if their daughters be capable,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will put it to them: but vir sapit qui pauca

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: loquitur; a soul feminine saluteth us.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Enter JAQUENETTA and COSTARD

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: God give you good morrow, master Parson.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Master Parson, quasi pers-on. An if one should be

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: pierced, which is the one?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Marry, master schoolmaster, he that is likest to a hogshead.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Piercing a hogshead! a good lustre of conceit in a

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: tuft of earth; fire enough for a flint, pearl enough

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: for a swine: 'tis pretty; it is well.

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: Good master Parson, be so good as read me this

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: letter: it was given me by Costard, and sent me

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: from Don Armado: I beseech you, read it.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Fauste, precor gelida quando pecus omne sub umbra

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Ruminat,--and so forth. Ah, good old Mantuan! I

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: may speak of thee as the traveller doth of Venice;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Venetia, Venetia,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Chi non ti vede non ti pretia.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Old Mantuan, old Mantuan! who understandeth thee

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: not, loves thee not. Ut, re, sol, la, mi, fa.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Under pardon, sir, what are the contents? or rather,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: as Horace says in his--What, my soul, verses?

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Ay, sir, and very learned.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Let me hear a staff, a stanze, a verse; lege, domine.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: If love make me forsworn, how shall I swear to love?

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Ah, never faith could hold, if not to beauty vow'd!

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Though to myself forsworn, to thee I'll faithful prove:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Those thoughts to me were oaks, to thee like

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: osiers bow'd.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Study his bias leaves and makes his book thine eyes,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Where all those pleasures live that art would

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: comprehend:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: If knowledge be the mark, to know thee shall suffice;

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Well learned is that tongue that well can thee commend,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: All ignorant that soul that sees thee without wonder;

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Which is to me some praise that I thy parts admire:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Thy eye Jove's lightning bears, thy voice his dreadful thunder,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Which not to anger bent, is music and sweet fire.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Celestial as thou art, O, pardon, love, this wrong,

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: That sings heaven's praise with such an earthly tongue.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: You find not the apostraphas, and so miss the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: accent: let me supervise the canzonet. Here are

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: only numbers ratified; but, for the elegancy,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: facility, and golden cadence of poesy, caret.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Ovidius Naso was the man: and why, indeed, Naso,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: but for smelling out the odouriferous flowers of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: fancy, the jerks of invention? Imitari is nothing:

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: so doth the hound his master, the ape his keeper,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the tired horse his rider. But, damosella virgin,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: was this directed to you?

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: Ay, sir, from one Monsieur Biron, one of the strange

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: queen's lords.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will overglance the superscript: 'To the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: snow-white hand of the most beauteous Lady

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Rosaline.' I will look again on the intellect of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: the letter, for the nomination of the party writing

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: to the person written unto: 'Your ladyship's in all

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: desired employment, BIRON.' Sir Nathaniel, this

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Biron is one of the votaries with the king; and here

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: he hath framed a letter to a sequent of the stranger

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: queen's, which accidentally, or by the way of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: progression, hath miscarried. Trip and go, my

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: sweet; deliver this paper into the royal hand of the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: king: it may concern much. Stay not thy

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: compliment; I forgive thy duty; adieu.

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: Good Costard, go with me. Sir, God save your life!

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Have with thee, my girl.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Exeunt COSTARD and JAQUENETTA

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Sir, you have done this in the fear of God, very

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: religiously; and, as a certain father saith,--

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir tell me not of the father; I do fear colourable

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: colours. But to return to the verses: did they

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: please you, Sir Nathaniel?

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: Marvellous well for the pen.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I do dine to-day at the father's of a certain pupil

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: of mine; where, if, before repast, it shall please

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: you to gratify the table with a grace, I will, on my

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: privilege I have with the parents of the foresaid

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: child or pupil, undertake your ben venuto; where I

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: will prove those verses to be very unlearned,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: neither savouring of poetry, wit, nor invention: I

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: beseech your society.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: And thank you too; for society, saith the text, is

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: the happiness of life.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: And, certes, the text most infallibly concludes it.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: To DULL

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Sir, I do invite you too; you shall not

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: say me nay: pauca verba. Away! the gentles are at

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: their game, and we will to our recreation.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: LOVE'S LABOURS LOST
